briefTitle: Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of the Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine and the Non-Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Compared to the Non-Adjuvanted Trivalent Split Influenza Vaccine in Children 6 to < 72 Months of Age
officialTitle: A Phase III, Observer-Blind, Randomized, Multi-center Study to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of Fluad and Agriflu Compared to the Non-adjuvanted Trivalent Influenza Vaccine Fluzone in Children 6 to < 72 Months of Age

interventions.name: Licensed comparator trivalent split influenza vaccine (comparator TIV)

summary: This Study Aims to Evaluate the Safety, Tolerability, and Immunogenicity of the Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine and the Non-Adjuvanted Trivalent Subunit Influenza Vaccine Compared to the Non-Adjuvanted Trivalent Split Influenza Vaccine in Children 6 to \< 72 Months of Age.

primaryOutcome.measure: Comparison of Antibody Responses of aTIV With TIV and Comparator TIV in Terms of Geometric Mean Titers (GMTs) Against Homologous Strains
